WRITING.TEXT: yep
i left with my friend to borderlands 2. Best decision we've ever made. Boarderlands does loot right, period.
just the full game
Wow! What did you do to that?! Spill coke on it?
don't blame it on the preview. You'll eventually get one of the 'preview builds', which all still are slow, and the xbox button takes forever to register.
have an xbox one s. in the preview program. I've read some others complain about the same issue. But this has been a constant for me, even with my old one, and old controller.
I have one. I never use it. I use the xbox daily, which is where my seconds would add up :)

WRITING.TITLE: Can we stop getting new features for a month or two and get a performance/speed patches?
WRITING.TEXT:
I'd love it if I didn't have to guess if the system registered me pushing the Xbox button, and end up hitting it 4 times only for it to register once...or 4 times 30 seconds later. It seems the OS is bogging down and loading. In a world where seconds matter, lets make those seconds count. Please, Microsoft, lets work on the speed of the OS for a few months.
Edit: Observations after a day: seems either one of three opinions. 1) I'm spot on ~70% 2) I'm in the preview program, I should shut up and accept that its slow because of it. ~ 20% 3) Buy a PS4 (which I own and never use, I LOVE my xbox) or make fun of me for asking for 'more stability'
Cont. I'm really happy with Xbox. Its got so many features I love, like, and never knew I needed. And they keep coming (I love it, it proves it is super supported and feels 'alive' and fresh.) I just want it to be faster/more instant. In a world where every Iphone is 50% faster, and seconds feel like minutes, I would Personally LOVE optimizations over features at this point (We finally got background music....what more could we want?!).
If anyone has an extra code, i would truly appreciate it!

Level 5 XboxStaff Posted 09-06-2016 1:57 PM The latest 1610 update is rolling out to select Preview participants this afternoon at 2:00 PM PDT. For more information about the rollout, please see this post in Announcements forum.
http://forums.xbox.com/xbox_early_access/update_preview/update_preview_forums/xosu_1610/f/5637/t/2205455.aspx
HOW TO GET IT
If your console is in Instant-On mode and you have been selected to receive the update, it will download and install the update and reboot to standby.
NOTE: Once the update is available to you, you can manually begin the update by launching the Guide and navigating to All Settings System Console info updates.
If you have been selected to receive the update and your console hasnt downloaded and installed the update by 2:00 PM PDT 9/7/2016, you will be prompted to do so at that time.
DETAILS
OS version released: rs1_xbox_rel_1610.160901-1900 Available: 2:00PM PDT 9/6 (1:00 AM GMT 7/9)
NEW FEATURES
Clubs
Check out the Community tab on the dashboard to find the new entry point for Clubs on Xbox Live. Create your own Club or explore the Clubs our team has created. You can request an invite to a Club, share content to the Activity Feed, and check out Clubs on Game Hubs and your friends profiles. Weve got a lot more functionality coming soon!
Join the Xbox Preview club for all the latest information on Xbox Preview, comment on posts from the Xbox Preview team, and interact with other Xbox Preview participants.
Club Quests:
Check out the following Quests for Clubs: Joining a Club In The Club Mod the Club Create a Club
Clubs FAQs
I just joined a Club, but Im having problems posting or sharing to the Activity Feed. Workaround: Please wait for 5 minutes after joining a Club before posting or sharing to the Activity Feed. I requested a Club invite, but it still hasnt come through! Workaround: Club notifications arent yet functional, and it can take a while for moderators to check for new Club invite requests. You can also try messaging the Club owner directly.
LFG (Looking for Group)
Need to find players to help unlock an Achievement, complete a weekly quest, or build a team? Xbox Looking for Group allows you to post a want ad that other players can see and answer. Each post can contain a description, number of players needed, and searchable tags. You can tag a post with communication and playstyle preferences like Mic required or Cooperative, Achievements you want to pursue, or custom tags created by the community for each game. Once youve found other players who share your goals, you can quickly and easily form a party and get into your game.
Well be adding new features and upgrades to Looking for Group over the course of the preview, but were excited to get this build into your hands so you can start giving your feedback.
Note that you may not find Looking for Group posts for every game due to the limited size of the Preview community. In general, we recommend trying out LFG for multiplayer games that involve co-operative gameplay or team competitions such as:
Halo 5: Guardians Minecraft: Xbox One Edition Destiny Call of Duty: Black Ops III Tom Clancys Rainbow Six Siege Overwatch: Origins Edition
LFG Quests:
Check out the following Quest for LFG: LFG
Find Looking for Group
The easiest way to get started with Looking for Group is to open the Parties tab on the Guide. You can browse and search a games LFG posts on its Game Hub. Choose from your games by clicking the Looking for Group button on the Parties tab of the Guide. When you Host or request to join an LFG, you can find it in the Upcoming list on the Parties tab of the Guide. The Parties tab will also show you LFG posts your friends have made. If youre the leader of a party and need more players, you can also create a Looking for Group post directly from the Party roster.
LFG Known Issues
LFG posts do not yet show up in user profiles, Clubs, or the friends list. LFG posts can currently only be posted to all of Xbox LIVE, visible to everyone on each Game Hubs Looking for Group page. LFG posts can currently only be posted for right now. LFG posts will time out if you disconnect from Xbox LIVE for more than 5 minutes. You can currently only host one LFG post at a time, however, you can request to join as many as you want. On the Game Hub Looking for Group page, posts do not yet update in real-time. Youll need to hit the refresh button or change your search tags to get fresh results. Currently, all LFG posts for a game are visible in all regions and languages. Currently, custom tags cannot start with a number. When creating an LFG post, creation will fail if your custom tags or description contain profanity. When selecting tags to create or search for an LFG post, Achievement tags are not yet sorted by whether they are locked or unlocked. Currently, Party Chat sessions linked to an LFG post can be joined (without having to use Looking for Group) if the Party is set to Joinable. The Posted Time is not yet shown when browsing LFG posts on a Game Hub, however, posts are sorted with the newest at the top. To create or view LFG posts, your Privacy Online Safety setting, Others can communicate with voice, text, or invites must be set to Everybody. Dont worry, Looking for Group will let you know if this setting isnt set to Everybody and will help you change it if you like. You cannot currently view previous LFG posts. At this time only Xbox LIVE-enabled games support LFG posts. At this time LFG posts for Xbox 360 games will not show up in the Game Hub, but will be visible to you and your friends in the Party tab of the Guide. At this time when choosing a game for a Looking for Group post, search may not find a game if you havent played it before.
FIXES
Backward Compatibility This build contains a fix to address stuttering and framerate issues in backward compatible games.
FIXES Backward Compatibility This build contains a fix to address stuttering and framerate issues in backward compatible games.

maybe the most important part of this build
FIXES Backward Compatibility This build contains a fix to address stuttering and framerate issues in backward compatible games.

I had the surface pro 2. I loved it. Its a bit thicker than the 3 and 4, but its just as fast as the 3...and a little slower than my core m pro 4. Its worth it, but check swappa...you'll get a better price (thats where i sold mine). The WORST thing about the 2 is the keyboard. I SUCKS compared to the 3/4, its what pushed me over the edge to sell it and get the 4. The trackpad was the worst part. I LOVE the glass trackpad on the 4. Technically, you can use the 3/4 keyboard on the 2....but it will slightly stick out past the pro 2's dimentions....and this might be worth the savings to you.
Thats my 2cents. Enjoy! Its a sweet machine!
ultrabluray, for some, could be the difference, however: If you have a 4k tv: Definitely worth it now, If you DO NOT have a 4k tv: definitely not worth it now.
upgrade to the console. You wont regret it. And you have a valuable warranty, unlike the elite controller, which will inevitable break, just when its out of warranty.
and this is whats sad. PlayStation streaming works better on a Microsoft product, than Microsofts own product. "frowny face"
xbox one s INPUT does not support 4K....which is the stupidest thing on the planet. Do NOT plug in your 4k enabled Roku 4 into the xbox.

I would love it, only to pass it on to a less fortunate friend (who i bought his xbox one for him...so he could play with his friends) Either way, your doing a good deed!

WRITING.TITLE: [Tech] Xbox one S and Tivo
WRITING.TEXT: Anyone having issues with the xbox one S finding the tivo (in my case roamio Plus) signal? It worked fine with the normal xbox one. I've tried changing xbox to 1080p, changing tivo only to 720p, different hdmi cable, and ps4 to the hdmi in (and that works no problem) I can plug it strait into my av receiver and it pics up the tivo no problem. Any help is appreciated (or your own experiences)

WRITING.TITLE: Xbox One S and Tivo
WRITING.TEXT:
Anyone have an xbox one s and tivo? I have roamio plus, and while setting it up, it detects its plugged in for like 1 second (not long enough to show anything on the tv) and then acts like there is no signal. Wasn't sure how the xbox one s handles a non 4k signal from my tivo box. I've tried setting the xbox to 1080p....i've tried setting tivo output to 720p...still not working. I've plugged it directly into my av reciever, and works 100%. I've plugged my ps4 into my xbox one s hdmi in, and it detects it 100%. Not sure what i'm missing. It worked just fine on my regular xbox one.
Any help would be appreciated.
yeah, thats why my my title said 2014 series.

no, they are not the same!
HDMI Ports5 (2 side / 3 down) HDMI Port 1 SpecUHD Video @30Hz, HDCP 2.2 support HDMI Port 2 SpecUHD Video @30Hz, HDCP 2.2 support HDMI Port 3 SpecUHD Video @30Hz HDMI Port 4 SpecUHD Video @30Hz HDMI Port 5 SpecUHD Video @60Hz, HDCP 2.2 support
same
why port 3? (as apposed to 1?)
it is....but the 2014 70 has a 10bit panel (but No HDR)
crap....i use 5 for the 'game mode'....do i want 10 bit panel...or game mode....(gonna have to unhang it off the wall to test (unless someone else already has)
but i lose my 'game mode' (less lag)....wonder which is better.

WRITING.TITLE: Anyone Else have a Vizio P 2014 4k series? Whats does your 4k info screen look like?
WRITING.TEXT: I have the 70 and i get all red circles except for the top 4k one. I know the set has a 10 bit panel (but does not have hdr). Using HDMI 5.
